title: 820-3115 - U7200 Pin 17 fluctuating.
message:
So power comes in on U7200::16 which is a nice steady 12.62v.
But PP5v_S5 which exits on ::17 is fluctuating.

So my questions is, could Q7840 be the problem causing U7200 to brown out and reset, or should I just replace U7200?

title: 820-3115 - U7200 Pin 17 fluctuating.
message:
12.62V is a bit high, should be 12.56V, check sense resistors.......

SMC_PM_G2_EN is also fluctuating???

title: 820-3115 - U7200 Pin 17 fluctuating.
message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 15778"]12.62V is a bit high, should be 12.56V, check sense resistors.......[/QUOTE]
Yes, but I figured many components aren't running. Will check and report back shortly.

[QUOTE]SMC_PM_G2_EN is also fluctuating???[/QUOTE]
Correct. From 0 - 3.5v

It seems PP3v42_G3H is fluctuating too now (at least it is at U7941). Didn't pick up on that yesterday.

title: 820-3115 - U7200 Pin 17 fluctuating.
message: Actually PP3v42_G3H is stable almost everywhere else. :|

title: 820-3115 - U7200 Pin 17 fluctuating.
message: I've lost the green light and PPDCIN_G3H is going from 16.75 to 15.86 and back again.

title: 820-3115 - U7200 Pin 17 fluctuating.
message: Is this water damage???? Does it work with a pre charged battery???

title: 820-3115 - U7200 Pin 17 fluctuating.
message:
Doesn't appear to be water damaged and is really clean.

Doesn't work off a battery.

title: 820-3115 - U7200 Pin 17 fluctuating.
message: First get green light back. 3V42 present? SMC_RESET high? If both are OK first suspect is crap under the SMC.

title: 820-3115 - U7200 Pin 17 fluctuating.
message:
SMC_RESET is 0.
PP3v42_G3H is missing not completely now.

Seems to be going backwards quickly. :)

title: 820-3115 - U7200 Pin 17 fluctuating.
message: Fix 3V42 first, you should be able to do that on your own now.

title: 820-3115 - U7200 Pin 17 fluctuating.
message:
Please explain whether [I]PP3V42_G3H is missing not completely now[/I] means you have PP3V42_G3H or don't. 

What voltages do you have at pins 1, 3, 4, 6,  and 7 of U5010?
